nodes.body: Mind doing `posPart` and `negPart` while you're at it?

> Mind doing `posPart` and `negPart` while you're at it?

Sure.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7667730629/job/20898185626)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7667730629/job/20898185767)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7667730629/job/20898185256)

Could you also add three lemmas of that form (also with the measurability attribute):
`lemma measurable.abs {f : Î± â†’ Î²} (hf : Measurable f) : Measurable (fun x â†¦ |f x|) := sorry`

It's an immediate consequence of what you proved, but writing `hf.abs` is more convenient than `measurable_abs.comp hf`.

Your algebra brain is making you see rings everywhere ðŸ˜€
```suggestion
variable {Î± Î² : Type*} [Lattice Î±] [MeasurableSpace Î±] [MeasurableSupâ‚‚ Î±] [MeasurableSpace Î²]
  {f : Î² â†’ Î±} (hf : Measurable f)
```
You don't need Lattice or Group structures on `S`/`Î²`, do you?

> Your algebra brain is making you see rings everywhere ðŸ˜€

Indeed. Still `Î±` needs to be a group for `oneLePart` to be defined so maybe I should call it `G`?

I've made the changes. I think we're getting there.

```suggestion
protected theorem Measurable.oneLePart : Measurable fun x â†¦ oneLePart (f x) :=
```
and check `Measurable.posPart` is protected as well
I think the eta-expanded version is better for those composition lemmas.

You have very specific taste ;)
Ok, I've changed these back.

> @fpvandoorn wrote a note (about continuity, but the same applies to measurability) in which he explained why `Measurable fun x â†¦ leOnePart (f x)` is better than `Measurable (leOnePart âˆ˜ f)` for that type of lemma. https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/notes.html#continuity%20lemma%20statement It is likely specific to Lean 3 and now obsolete since the continuity and measurability tactics use aesop, but I'm not sure.

I see. Thanks for the link. 

> In applications of that lemma, I expect the goal to have the form `Measurable fun x â†¦ leOnePart (f x)` more often that the other. Also the thread https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Aesop.20and.20Lambdas make me think that we might just need both versions.

I can add the other spelling as primed version is you think it's necessary.
 
> @YaelDillies can you tell why you think `Measurable (leOnePart âˆ˜ f)` is better?

No, I think YaÃ«l agrees with you. I was the one that was asking for some justification.

Oh right, I got confused and switched mentally red and green lines in the diff.
Let's merge that PR as it is now. We'll see if we need other versions of the lemmas as we use them. Given recent discussions on zulip about `fprop`, it's also possible that the tactic we use for measurability changes completely in the near future.

I don't know if your know, but this is legal:
```suggestion
protected theorem Measurable.leOnePart : Measurable fun x â†¦ leOnePart (f x) :=
```
Yes, but I find it confusing sometimes. I guess it's fine here.

```suggestion
protected theorem Measurable.mabs : Measurable fun x â†¦ mabs (f x) :=
```
